intro: Lobelia morogoroensis, commonly known as Morogoro lobelia, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
